trans-unit.target: TEXT_KINGMC107_04903_SEQ_00<tab>Wuk Lamat wishes to know how traversable the Ty'iinbek Traverse is.
TEXT_KINGMC107_04903_TODO_00<tab>Speak with Erenville.
TEXT_KINGMC107_04903_TODO_01<tab>Speak with Krile.
TEXT_KINGMC107_04903_TODO_02<tab>Speak with Alphinaud.
TEXT_KINGMC107_04903_TODO_03<tab>Speak with Erenville.
TEXT_KINGMC107_04903_TODO_04<tab>Use the pairing stone on the glowing rock.
TEXT_KINGMC107_04903_TODO_05<tab>Speak with Erenville.
TEXT_KINGMC107_04903_KRILE_000_001<tab>For as weathered as our Promise looks, she's positively glowing with confidence. What in the world happened?
TEXT_KINGMC107_04903_ERENVILLE_000_005<tab>The twins ran me from one end of the Ut'ohmu Horizon to the other, asking about everything of remote interest along the way...
TEXT_KINGMC107_04903_ALPHINAUD_000_010<tab>Erenville's tour was both educational and exciting! I hope we can persuade him to conduct another in the lower forests.
TEXT_KINGMC107_04903_ALISAIE_000_015<tab>Did something happen while we were away? There's a certain satisfied air about you...
TEXT_KINGMC107_04903_WUKLAMAT_000_020<tab>So what's the state of the Ty'iinbek Traverse?
TEXT_KINGMC107_04903_ERENVILLE_000_021<tab>Still being cleared, I'd assume. Hunmu Rruk said he would notify us as soon as work was done.
TEXT_KINGMC107_04903_KRILE_000_022<tab>Then perhaps now would be a good time to consider how we might reclaim Wuk Lamat's stolen keystone. The next feat will be our last, after all.
TEXT_KINGMC107_04903_WUKLAMAT_000_023<tab>Oh, I already got it back.
TEXT_KINGMC107_04903_KRILE_000_024<tab>What!? When?
TEXT_KINGMC107_04903_ALPHINAUD_000_025<tab>Not to mention how! This is Bakool Ja Ja we're talking about!
TEXT_KINGMC107_04903_WUKLAMAT_000_026<tab>...So I taught him a lesson and took my keystone back.
TEXT_KINGMC107_04903_ALISAIE_000_027<tab>You bested Bakool Ja Ja in single combat? Bravo!
TEXT_KINGMC107_04903_WUKLAMAT_000_028<tab>Hehe, what can I say? I've had good friends to encourage and cheer me on.
TEXT_KINGMC107_04903_HUNMURRUK_000_029<tab>There you are. Our excavators have contacted me with news of their success. The Ty'iinbek Traverse is now safe for travel.
TEXT_KINGMC107_04903_ERENVILLE_000_030<tab>Then we finally can make for Mamook.
TEXT_KINGMC107_04903_ALISAIE_000_031<tab>Come to think of it, isn't it Bakool Ja Ja's home? We can only hope its residents don't share his winning personality.
TEXT_KINGMC107_04903_ALPHINAUD_000_032<tab>If it is indeed the city where Ketenramm first met the Dawnservant, surely some civility awaits us.
TEXT_KINGMC107_04903_HUNMURRUK_000_033<tab>I would not be so certain.

TEXT_KINGMC107_04903_HUNMURRUK_000_034<tab>It is true that the Dawnservant received Ketenramm in Mamook, and was instrumental in the establishment of friendly relations between the Xbr'aal and Mamool Ja.
TEXT_KINGMC107_04903_HUNMURRUK_000_035<tab>But since that time, most of the Mamool Ja who supported his peace have left their city in favor of abiding in the capital.
TEXT_KINGMC107_04903_HUNMURRUK_000_036<tab>What remains is a cloister of Mamook. And while these traditionalists do not take up arms against us, neither do they bear great love for outsiders.
TEXT_KINGMC107_04903_WUKLAMAT_000_037<tab>Whatever they're like, the people of Mamook are also of Tuliyollal. If I'm to be Dawnservant, it's my job to know them first of all.
TEXT_KINGMC107_04903_WUKLAMAT_000_038<tab>Well, we'll be on our way, then. I'm glad I could learn about where I came from. And eat so much xibruq pibil besides!
TEXT_KINGMC107_04903_WUKLAMAT_000_039<tab>Thank you for everything, Hunmu Rruk. Till next time, take care!
TEXT_KINGMC107_04903_ERENVILLE_000_040<tab>First we make our way across the Xobr'it Cinderfield, due southeast.
TEXT_KINGMC107_04903_HUNMURRUK_000_041<tab>How you have grown indeed...
TEXT_KINGMC107_04903_WUKLAMAT_000_050<tab>I filled my bag with xibruq pibil before we left, but I'm down to my last serving already...
TEXT_KINGMC107_04903_KRILE_000_055<tab>I wonder if the First and Second Promises have already arrived in Mamook.
TEXT_KINGMC107_04903_ALPHINAUD_000_060<tab>If Bakool Ja Ja ran in this direction after losing to Wuk Lamat, then he undoubtedly was returning to Mamook.
TEXT_KINGMC107_04903_ALISAIE_000_065<tab>After seeing that battlefield, I find it miraculous that the Dawnservant was able to negotiate a peace.
TEXT_KINGMC107_04903_ERENVILLE_000_070<tab>The Traverse will bring us straight into the Ja Tiika Heartland.
TEXT_KINGMC107_04903_ERENVILLE_000_071<tab>...Remember how you insisted this forest is green?
TEXT_KINGMC107_04903_KRILE_000_080<tab>This path is quite steep, isn't it? Let us take our time and descend safely.
TEXT_KINGMC107_04903_KRILE_000_83<tab>I'll take a moment's rest, I think...
TEXT_KINGMC107_04903_ALPHINAUD_000_090<tab>I spoke with one of the excavators on my way down. Apparently, Bakool Ja Ja cleared away the one fallen tree remaining by barreling through it.
TEXT_KINGMC107_04903_ALPHINAUD_000_091<tab>That Wuk Lamat single-handedly defeated someone possessed of such physical might is nothing short of remarkable.
TEXT_KINGMC107_04903_ALPHINAUD_000_092<tab>Still, we ought to proceed with caution. There's no telling what his wounded pride might compel him to attempt.
TEXT_KINGMC107_04903_ALPHINAUD_000_100<tab>We will doubtless face Bakool Ja Ja again. I cannot say I relish the thought of the reunion.
TEXT_KINGMC107_04903_ALISAIE_000_105<tab>Erenville said this Traverse was dug to facilitate incursions into the forests above. Intentions notwithstanding, you have to admire the dedication.
TEXT_KINGMC107_04903_WUKLAMAT_000_115<tab>Just look at this thing! What a vibrant glow!
TEXT_KINGMC107_04903_ERENVILLE_000_120<tab>Alluring, isn't it?
TEXT_KINGMC107_04903_ERENVILLE_000_121<tab>In more ways than one. Take my pairing stone and hold it close to the glowing rock.
TEXT_KINGMC107_04903_ERENVILLE_000_125<tab>Go on. Use my pairing stone and see what happens.
TEXT_KINGMC107_04903_SYSTEM_000_130<tab>As you hold the pairing stone in the soft glow, it affixes itself to the boulder with surprising force.
TEXT_KINGMC107_04903_ERENVILLE_000_131<tab>Pairing stones are natural magnets─and that's a meteorite filled with iron. One of many remnants of an ancient meteor shower.
TEXT_KINGMC107_04903_ERENVILLE_000_132<tab>The heterogeneous aether they emit causes surrounding flora to glow unique hues, as you can see.
TEXT_KINGMC107_04903_WUKLAMAT_000_133<tab>So these glowing boulders came plummeting down from the heavens? Vidraal be merciful...
TEXT_KINGMC107_04903_WUKLAMAT_100_134<tab>There you are!
TEXT_KINGMC107_04903_KRILE_200_134<tab>Blue! It's all blue!
TEXT_KINGMC107_04903_ALPHINAUD_300_134<tab>A far cry from the upper forests, indeed.
TEXT_KINGMC107_04903_WUKLAMAT_000_134<tab>This place is already so fascinating... I'm eager to hear what the people of Mamook can tell us about it!
TEXT_KINGMC107_04903_WUKLAMAT_000_135<tab>Keep running! We're almost there!
TEXT_KINGMC107_04903_ALPHINAUD_000_140<tab>Now to see whether or not Hunmu Rruk's fears were well founded...
TEXT_KINGMC107_04903_ALISAIE_000_145<tab>Rather more quiet than I expected...
TEXT_KINGMC107_04903_KRILE_000_150<tab>I wonder what the final feat will be.
TEXT_KINGMC107_04903_WUKLAMAT_000_155<tab>And here we finally are... Now to find the elector!
TEXT_KINGMC107_04903_ERENVILLE_000_160<tab>As this is also my first time visiting Mamook, I have no experience interacting with the locals.
TEXT_KINGMC107_04903_ERENVILLE_000_161<tab>But given Hunmu Rruk's parting words, I would advise...a cautionary approach.
